data.title: The Lost Art of Putting: Introducing the Six Putting Performance Principles
data.meta_description:
Read 19 reviews from the world‚Äôs largest community 
    for readers. Does the stroke create the putt or does the putt create the stroke?To be child-like is to h‚Ä¶
data.text:
September 24, 2018

The book was very polar.

On one hand, the main thesis of the book is wonderful and liberating: putt based on your intuition and feel while have a sound technical base (e.g., green reading as foundation). You yourself will make you successful.

On another hand, the book was written and finalized in sloppy fashion especially on two fronts: 1st) The ‚Äùafterwords‚Äù in each chapter felt like commercials that were glued on top and added negative value to the experience as they took away from the main messages (e.g., Trackmann + Odyssey pieces); 2nd) The Kindle version page layout was not working (e.g., unformatted titles for sub-chapters).

As a final note, you get better experience by listening Karl Morris on ‚ÄùOn the Mark‚Äù PGA Tour podcast, published 22nd of August 2018. All the content without the extra‚Äôs that dilute the messages.

March 9, 2023

Fascinating

I heartily recommend this book to any golfer who is not happy with his/her putting results. The authors showed me what to focus on, how to manage myself and correctly channel my reactions to missed putts. Their two questions posed throughout the book are excellent thoughts to consider in the early stages of planning the journey the ball makes to the hole. Well done guys!

August 29, 2018

A great read - that makes a lot of sense

I like the sectional approach building the themes / principles in a logical order. when put all together feels like a fantastic tool kit to have and flipped quite a bit of my thinking / approach to my putting on its head. I‚Äôm looking forward to starting putting them in to practice tomorrow. üòÄ

September 22, 2020

Excellent book on putting!

This is the most wholistic book I have read on putting. It deals with the mental side, green reading, equipment, and practice. It doesn‚Äôt talk a lot about stroke because the authors believe the stroke is personal and less important to making putts. Great book!

July 26, 2018

A brilliant brilliant book

Quite simply one of the best books I've ever read on golf. It will make you fall in love with putting. The importance of pace, breathing, visualisation, how to read a putt: it's all in here, but completely accessible. It's a masterpiece.

March 10, 2020

One opinion

While visualization is important before making the putt or any other stroke it‚Äôs absolutely imperative that the golfer understand where the face of the club is pointing. Without that element of control, visualization itself is useless.

June 29, 2020

As a scratch golfer I give it 3 stars as no earth shattering insights, It‚Äôs more a compilation of Karl Morris coaching. Although imaging the pace of the golf ball rolling into the hole has really helped my putt-Mark ratio!

July 6, 2021

Great book for concepts in putting

Loved the book. Gives great insights on the mental aspect of putting along with great pointers in what‚Äôs important when it comes to getting a putt to go into the hole.

January 16, 2022

Words of Wisdom

The emphasis on emotions, visualization and

right brain thinking in all aspects of golf has not only improved my score but more importantly my enjoyment of the game.

January 4, 2019

Good read

Some really nice ideas in this short book, there isn‚Äôt a load of padding in it either, I‚Äôll be trying 5-6 of them on the practice green later.

October 16, 2019

Great, fresh perspective

Really nice to have a new way of looking at putting, and remove a lot of the stress and tension that I have felt.

December 27, 2019

How to putt by letting go and not getting in your own way

February 2, 2020

Simple yet effective

Some good insight on how to stay positive and a few simple & practical ideas to take onto the course

May 25, 2020

Best book on putting!

This is an outstanding book. I went from a streaky putter with little confidence to now i putt with confidence. Highly recommend!

June 18, 2020

Great

Great book, interesting thoughts and techniques. Good for any golfer from screech to high ha i copes looking to help their game.

June 24, 2020

There's some good content from Gary and Karl but I thought they are shamelessly advertising certain products from companies like Trackman

November 7, 2023

Great book on putting. Addresses the mental aspect of putting, as well as the art of finding the best line and pace and reading greens.

January 13, 2020

A few good key ideas but a lot of data which is useless for the reader. Nevertheless it made a difference in my putting. Lots of publicity at the end of each chapter.
